page.title: 02Farms in Norwell & Cromwell
page.content: This is mainly a{cereal growing area, oil seed rape being the main crop, followed by wheat and barley. There is a small amount of oats. Other crops such as beans and peas and occasionally potatoes and sugar beet tend to be grown in rotation. It is a{mixed farming}area. There are 5 dairy herds of British Friesians, 2 intensive beef units, 1 traditional suckler herd, 1 traditional beef herd and 3 farmers with flocks of sheep. Farming in the area is{heavily {mechanised}and so the amount of labour required has fallen sharply. The farms tend to be family concerns,there only being 4 outside employees in the whole area. The size of farms ranges from{55}to{400 acres.}There are still 20 acres of glebe land belonging to the church.
